oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1957-11-16 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from November 16, 1957. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Ernest Tubb (host/performer), guest performers the Everly Brothers, Jim Reeves, Marty Robbins, and Ray Price, and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Tommy Jackson, the Jordanaires, Chet Atkins, Minnie Pearl, and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 945th broadcast, the 32nd anniversary of the Opry, and that the 6th annual Disc Jockey Festival is taking place.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Chet Atkins; Minnie Pearl; Everly Brothers; Stringbean; Ernest Tubb; Texas Troubadours
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Ernest Tubb introduces Chet Atkins -- Swedish Rhapsody (Chet Atkins) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) -- Prince Albert commercial (Ernest Tubb, Marty Robbins, Jim Reeves, Ray Price) -- Prince Albert jingle -- Ernest Tubb introduces the Everly Brothers -- Wake Up Little Susie (Everly Brothers) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Stringbean -- Going Down The Road Feeling Bad (Stringbean) -- Ernest Tubb talks -- My Treasure (Ernest Tubb) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Ernest Tubb) -- Camel Cigarettes jingle -- Station announcements (Grant Turner) -- Noel Hotel commercial (Grant Turner) (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); United States.
